to add the eggs
I'm going to push the flower down a
little bit unless
the butter is going to be added next you

be a little bit hard okay we're all set
you're going to let this sit for about
an hour in a place where it's not very
drafty
so you're going to melt the butter on
like a medium heat the goo is really the
best part it's what gives it that really
nice like kind of crunchy texture it's
dark brown sugar and the next thing
you're going to add is some honey you
want the sides just the edges to start

so now I'm going to add the salt
I'm saying that's the goo
during this step you're going to take
the dough that you let rise and you're

flatter way out dough balls that are
going to be between 9 grams and 13 grams
you want them to be about this size of
like a little bigger than a marble so
now we're going to roll them in the

to get the monkey bread to kind of get
fully coated and then once they're
coated you're going to put them right
into your bundt pan and it's six balls
for each punch
this is technically the bottom of the
monkey dough you're just going to kind
of press it out to the size of the pan
and just poke it in the center so that
it goes around the center part and this
is ready to go into the oven now and
it's going to bake at 350 degrees for 20
minutes so you're going to put them in
for 10 minutes turn it around and then
bake it for another time this is our
finished monkey bread and it
beautiful on the inside it's my favorite
